scenario_text.value: (I’m tired... That was a tough fight.)

(Everyone else must be tired, too.
I hope they can rest well.)

(I’m glad everyone’s back on good terms.
That was my biggest concern.)
(But a few things are still bothering me.)

(What’s with Haru and the professor? And
Garurumon’s attitude? What’s going on?)

(I have no idea, but we’re definitely getting
closer to entering the enemy base.)

Takuma? You look like something’s bothering
you again!

Yeah. Thinking about everything going on
makes my head spin.

I know I should get some rest, but I don’t
feel like sleeping.
Did you say you can’t sleep, Takuma?
Oh! You too, Aoi?

You’re both worked up. Maybe you should drink
something to try to relax.
I hardly think we should be wasting supplies.

But not getting enough sleep is even worse.
We have extra supplies and water.

That’s true...
*sigh*
I wish I was as easy-going as you, Takuma.

Or that I could say whatever’s on my mind,
like Saki.

Really?
I think your seriousness is your strength.
Hm, I guess so.

Plus, you’ve also been making sure Labramon
doesn’t get hurt.
I think that’s amazing.

You’re always looking out for everyone.
It really is amazing!

You have your own strengths, Aoi.
Being serious is important, too.
Thanks, guys.
Now maybe you’ll be able to sleep better.
I do feel a little more relaxed now.

Yeah, I think I’ll hit the hay.
Good night, Takuma.
Good night, Aoi.

(She always helps a lot, so I hope that
helped her, too.)

(It’s finally almost time to head to the
enemy base.)

(There must be a clue about how to get home
in the factory east of the apartments.)

(I’d better rest up to get ready for
tomorrow.)

Takuma!
Come eat this with me!

Huh?
Is that...canned meat?

Looks good, but there’s only one of this type
so I’ve had my eye on it.
They said not to waste supplies, though...

But we’re near the enemy base, so we might as
well live a little!

True.
Okay, let’s eat it in secret!

Hah!
I knew you’d understand, Takuma!

All right, here goes!
Here, take it.
Huh? I thought we were gonna share it?

Yeah, but you helped me so much today.
So I wanted to, like, thank you...
Minoru...

Thanks a lot.
But let’s enjoy it together!
Okay, I’ll have some then!

You knew Takuma was gonna say that all along,
didn’t you?

Hehe, was it that obvious?
I mean, knowing Takuma...

He’s always nice to everyone around him,
always bringing people together.
Like a hero...
Huh?

Nothing, nothing!
Let’s hurry up and eat!
Um, sure.

Hmph.
Humans...

(Falcomon sure looks happy despite his
words.)

(Falcomon and Minoru got over their problems,
and we’re near the enemy base.)

(Things are bound to get worse starting
tomorrow.)

(Still, being appreciated by smiling friends
makes me feel like I can handle it.)

(Let’s do our best tomorrow.
We’ll find a way back to our world somehow.)
Oh, you’re still awake?
It’s Ryo and Kunemon.
Kew!
Hey, Kunemon.
You having trouble sleeping?

I can’t stop thinking about how we’ll be at
the enemy base soon.

You know, Takuma...
I was so scared of this world at first.

I know.
You were always shaking like crazy.

Uh, right...
Anyway, I don’t feel that way anymore.

It’s hard to survive, and I almost died, but
working together with everyone’s not so bad.
And I met Kunemon, too.
Kewww.

So, like, I don’t know how to put this into
words, but...

Haha, you always have a hard time with words,
don’t you?

Shut up!
I just forgot what I was gonna say!

Whatever. Go get some sleep.
You won’t do much good running on empty.

Good idea.
I think I will!

(Ryo used to be really scared, but now he’s
more strong and positive.)

(The same goes for the others. We’ve all
grown and gotten stronger than before.)

(We can do this. We’re all gonna survive
whatever this enemy base has in store.)
(We will all make it back to our world.)
Huh? You having trouble sleeping, too?

Yep.
I’m guessing you’re in the same boat?

Yeah. I thought I’d grab some water, and then
I saw you in the cafeteria.

Even if you can’t sleep after getting water,
it’s still best to lie down.

You too, Takuma. You’ve been running around
all day and must be worn out.

You’re right, I should let my body rest.
Thanks for the advice, Floramon.
So, is anything bothering you, Takuma?
Huh?
I mean, since you can’t sleep.

Just a lot to think about, I guess.
Too many things I don’t understand.
Oh...
What?

Wanna talk about it?
Might make you feel better.
Talk? Like, to you?

Yeah.
You’ve been listening to me so much.

Think of it as a thank you.
Then I won’t feel bad next time.

It’s okay if there are some things you can’t
say, or that are hard to talk about.

Tell me whatever you feel like sharing.
I’ll listen.
Okay... Thanks.

No prob!
I hope you’ll listen to me again, too!

I’m gonna grab some water and sleep.
Good night, Takuma!

Take it easy!
Good night.
Good night, you two.
Good night!

(I guess that cheered me up some.
Yeah... It definitely did.)
(My mind still feels like a mess...)

(But I know where to turn if I need to talk.
Saki, and the others would do the same, too.)

(Thinking about that makes me relaxed.
And now I’m sleepy, too...)

Feeling tired, Takuma?
Wanna hit the hay?

Sounds like a good idea.
Time for bed, Agumon.
(Tomorrow we finally head to the enemy base.)

(There’s bound to be a clue there to help us
get home. We can do this!)
I’m not happy to see you up so late, Takuma.

Uh, sorry.
I just couldn’t sleep, so...

Just kidding! Apologies. I couldn’t sleep
either, so I got up to take a walk.
Me and Shuuji were going for a stroll.
Okay, gotcha.

You know, Takuma. I’m scared about us going
to the enemy base.
You are?

There must be lots of enemies there.
Strong ones, like Arukenimon and Garurumon.

Can we really make it out alive from a place
like that?

We’ll be okay. We’re not alone.
We’ve got Agumon and Lopmon to help.

If we work to combine our strengths, we can
beat any challenge.

*sigh* I thought you’d say something along
those lines. Very reassuring of you.

So you pretended to be scared because you
knew I’d say that?

You saw right through me.
But I am scared, that’s no lie.

I don’t want to see anyone get hurt. I don’t
mean that as a leader, but as a friend.

But freezing up and getting scared makes it
hard to go anywhere at all.

Everyone, especially Lopmon, helped me
realize that.
Thank you, Shuuji...

I will become stronger, Takuma.
To protect everyone and move forward.
With Lopmon by my side.
I’m counting on you.
That’s my line, haha!

Well, time to get to bed and rest up in
preparation for the final battle!

(He used to always be so tense, but now he
seems more chill.)

(He might still lack confidence, but he makes
a fine leader in my book.)

(With Shuuji on our side, I think we’ll be
just fine.)

(We’ll find a way to get back to our world in
the enemy base. I just know it.)
Huh? You’re here?

Oh, Kaito!
You couldn’t fall asleep, either, huh?

I fell asleep just fine, but then I woke up.
That’s all.

And when he woke up, you were gone.
So he came looking for you.
That’s not how it happened...

(Kaito argues more quietly at night.
He’s more considerate than I thought.)

If you can’t sleep, eat something.
And at least lie down.

If you’re too hot or cold, then add or remove
some blankets.
What’s with the silent act?

Um, nothing...
I’m just a little surprised.
Surprised? By what?

You’re fussing over me so much, I thought you
must really be worried.
Me? Yeah, right.

I’m going to bed. Tomorrow we head to the
enemy base, so get some rest.

All righty! Goodnight!
And sweet dreams!

Good night to you, too!
And thanks!
Good night!
(Kaito is pretty thoughtful after all.)

(He’s right... I shouldn’t waste energy
thinking. I should get to bed.)

(My head feels better too now, thanks to him.
I feel like I’m gonna sleep well.)
BANG!
AAAH!

Haha, you should hear yourself!
Did I scare you?

Yes, you did. How long have you been there?
I didn’t even notice.

We just walked right in.
You were really lost in thought!

Have you heard?
Thinking too much makes you go bald.
Uh, I think I’m too young for that.

Then you should go to sleep.
Just thinking uses energy, you know.

But Takuma can’t fall asleep even though he’s
tired.

Because you won’t turn off your mind!
You gotta make your head totally empty!

Totally empty, huh?
Any idea how to do that?

Try counting up to something!
I heard that works.

How about counting the teeth on Syakomon’s
shell? One, two...
I’m sleepy already...
Wow, that was fast!

See? Told you so. You should lie down and
count to something, too.

Right.
Guess I’ll try it.

Actually, I’m glad we talked.
Miu was having trouble sleeping, too.

It’s pretty early for her bedtime.
But seeing your face calmed her down.
Huh?

*yawn* Time to hop under my blanket.
Night night, Takuma and Agumon!
Good night, Miu!

I’ll carry her back.
Have a good sleep.
Yeah, you too.
(Those two are like a whirlwind...)

(Well, at least I’m tired.
Maybe I should try Syakomon’s advice.)
Let’s go to bed too, Agumon!
Okay! I wonder what I should count to...

(Things are only gonna get harder starting
tomorrow...)

(All I can do is ignore what I don’t know,
and focus on doing what I can do right now.)
